channel.title: Lunar Altar REP++
channel.description: Right now the ancient altar works to switch to ancient magic, but the lunar altar does not change it to lunar magic. I have to use ::switch 2 to get to lunar magic. How do I fix this?

item.title: Lunar Altar REP++
item.dc:creator: @Woopzpkedu Woopzpkedu
item.description:
@Woopzpkedu wrote:

no problem also add my msn davec1153@hotmail.com if u need anyhelp in future

item.title: Lunar Altar REP++
item.dc:creator: @Football1smylife Football1smylife
item.description:
@Football1smylife wrote:

Woot, thanks my dude… I wish I could rep you again for helping me lol. I switched this case 410: if (c.playerMagicBook == 0) { with case 410: if (c.playerMagicBook <= 0) { because now it can switch to Lunar straight from the Ancient spellbook as well.

Read full topic

u need to find out the interfaces,ok found out go to client java and search ur ancients interface or search for

item.title: Lunar Altar REP++
item.dc:creator: @Football1smylife Football1smylife
item.description:
@Football1smylife wrote:

The altar works, but when I switch to Lunar Mage, the spell book goes blank. It switches back to normal fine though. I’m thinking that my Interface ID is different? How would I find out what it is and fix it?

Read full topic

item.title: Lunar Altar REP++
item.dc:creator: @Woopzpkedu Woopzpkedu
item.description:
@Woopzpkedu wrote:

umm this is for guthix altar but u can change the case to ur altar id add this to actionhandler.java

break; case 410: if (c.playerMagicBook == 0) { c.playerMagicBook = 2; c.setSidebarInterface(6, 16640); c.sendMessage("Your mind becomes stirred with thoughs of dreams."); c.getPA().resetAutocast(); } else { c.setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); //modern c.playerMagicBook = 0; c.sendMessage("You feel a drain on your memory."); c.autocastId = -1; c.getPA().resetAutocast(); }

Read full topic
